go_data.justification: Talin is required for cardiomyocyte adhesion and maintaining the one-to-one apposition of myofibril ends between cardiomyocytes.
Talin acts as a physical link between the Integrin dimer and the actin cytoskeleton, and its engagement of actin is modulated by Integrin-ECM adhesion.
Talin is required continuously for cardiomyocyte remodeling during heart growth in Drosophila.
Talin is required for the differentiation, growth, and remodeling of cardiomyocytes.
Talin localizes to the costameres of cardiomyocytes and is involved in cell-cell adhesion.
Talin acts as a physical link between the Integrin dimer and the actin cytoskeleton.
